page.title: 16Housing
page.content: Housing can be divided into three main categories in three distinct areas, linked by "ribbon development" dating from the 1920s to the present day. The village of Seal has a mixture of very old and more recent dwellings occupied largely by people who commute or people who work locally as skilled craftsmen or in agricultural trades. Around the Greatness area -historically very important in the growth of Sevenoaks- there is a pattern of pre-war and post-war terraces, the former to house workers in the nearby brick and sandworks, and the latter to house workers on the Vestry Industrial Estate of the 1950s and 1960s. Around the Wildernesse area there are many large houses in their own grounds whose owners mostly commute to London. A feature of the area is the closeness of council and private housing.
